decks.notes: The deck focuses on assembling the Doomsday combo to win the game in a single turn. It utilizes cards like Dark Ritual, Lotus Petal, and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate mana quickly, while also using disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo. Barrowgoyf and Murktide Regent provide additional threats, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps dig for combo pieces. Thassa's Oracle is the win condition, allowing the player to win the game if the library is stacked correctly with Doomsday. The deck is designed to be fast and powerful, aiming to win before the opponent can establish a strong board presence.

The main strategy of this Mardu Aggro deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy while deploying a fast and efficient creature base including Amped Raptor, Guide of Souls, and Ocelot Pride. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares to control the board. With a solid mana base including fetch lands and dual lands, as well as disruption with Wasteland, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through aggressive creature beats and incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Murktide Regent. With disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, along with counterspells like Force of Will, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own threats. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for key pieces and maintain card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to control the game tempo and win by overwhelming the opponent with a mix of disruption and aggression.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bringing them back onto the battlefield using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. By discarding creatures like Archon of Cruelty or Griselbrand with cards like Faithless Looting and Unmask, the deck can set up explosive plays to overwhelm the opponent. The combination of fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and rituals like Dark Ritual allow the deck to combo off early in the game, leading to a swift victory through reanimating massive threats.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with a Death & Taxes approach, utilizing a mix of disruptive creatures like Skyclave Apparition and aggressive threats like Overlord of the Balemurk. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for efficient deployment of creatures, while disruptive cards like Wasteland and Thoughtseize help control the opponent's game plan. The deck's synergy and balance between aggression and disruption make it a strong contender in the Legacy format, especially with the added value of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion.

The main concept of this Dragon Stompy Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base using cards like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon, while also ramping up quick mana with Ancient Tomb and Chrome Mox. The deck aims to apply pressure through aggressive creatures like Broadside Bombardiers and Pyrogoyf while also utilizing powerful spells such as Sundering Eruption and Fury. The inclusion of cards like Chalice of the Void and The One Ring helps control the opponent's plays, while cards like Urza's Saga and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional value and utility.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to capitalize on the powerful Eldrazi creatures and their ability to disrupt opponents' strategies by playing aggressively. By using cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher to control the opponent's hand and board, while also utilizing cards like Chalice of the Void to lock down opponent's spells, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with big, hard-hitting creatures. With the ability to generate mana quickly with cards like Grim Monolith and Ancient Tomb, this deck can establish a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The deck utilizes the "Show and Tell" combo to cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul onto the battlefield for free. This strategy is supported by cards like Omniscience and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to ensure that the opponent cannot easily deal with the big threats. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and thoughseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and Brainstorm/Ponder helps with deck manipulation. The goal is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and win the game before they have a chance to recover.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently play as many spells as possible in order to combo off and win the game in one explosive turn. By utilizing cards that allow for fast mana generation, free spells, and graveyard recursion, the deck aims to create a situation where all spells are played in a single turn, leading to a game-winning combination. The deck includes cards that allow for disruption of the opponent's game plan, while also setting up the necessary pieces for a successful combo finish.

The primary focus of this deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's game plan while building a strong board presence through a combination of efficient removal spells, disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy, and powerful creatures such as Amped Raptor and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast threats and disruption, utilizing a combination of white removal spells and black disruption cards to control the game and secure victory through a combination of creature beatdown and direct damage.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, backed up by efficient removal in Lightning Bolt and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to maintain control of the board through countermagic like Daze and Force of Will while also pressuring the opponent's life total with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The inclusion of cards like Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower ensure that the deck has additional ways to close out games and secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through various removal spells and counterspells, while also utilizing card advantage and manipulation to stay ahead of the opponent. It seeks to outvalue the opponent by efficiently handling threats and generating incremental advantages over time. The combination of powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo and versatile spells like Swords to Plowshares and Brainstorm allows the deck to adapt to different situations and come out on top in the long run. Additionally, the inclusion of disruptive creatures like Endurance and Uro helps to further disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Guide of Souls, Amped Raptor, and Ocelot Pride to quickly apply pressure to the opponent. It also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With efficient removal like Swords to Plowshares and versatile lands like Wasteland, the deck aims to control the board while steadily building its own board presence. The inclusion of Ajani, Nacatl Pariah adds another powerful threat to the mix, making this Mardu Aggro deck a formidable force in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and aggressive creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It includes powerful cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch, Mox Opal, and Urza's Saga to generate value and create a strong board presence. The main strategy is to play cards quickly and efficiently, disrupting the opponent's game plan with counter spells like Force of Will and controlling the board with creatures like Kappa Cannoneer and Patchwork Automaton. The key is to maintain tempo and pressure to outpace the opponent and secure a victory.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while controlling the board through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and land destruction. It aims to out-value the opponent with card advantage from cards like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, while also applying pressure with creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Murktide Regent. The deck also has access to powerful threats like Thundertrap Trainer to close out the game quickly. Overall, the deck seeks to control the game and dictate the pace of play.

The deck focuses on casting powerful artifact and creature threats early in the game to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes fast mana sources like City of Traitors and Chrome Mox to power out aggressive threats such as Hexing Squelcher and Broadside Bombardiers. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void to control the opponent's plays. The goal is to put pressure on the opponent and disrupt their game plan, ultimately leading to a quick victory through efficient aggression and disruption.
